abstract: Merck & Company agreed Wednesday to pay $2.3 billion to resolve several tax disputes, the Internal Revenue Service said. The drug company’s payment includes taxes, interest and penalties stemming from the disputes, which cover the tax years 1993-2001 and arose in part from Merck’s use of minority equity interest financing, the I.R.S. said.
